texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: author: Major Hayden date: '2024-07-02' Jellyfin is a great replacement for Plex, but I ran into non-stop problems with the Android app with a fatal player error. 🍿 tags:
texts.text: author: Major Hayden date: '2024-07-02' Jellyfin is a great replacement for Plex, but I ran into non-stop problems with the Android app with a fatal player error. 🍿 tags:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: container
texts.text: container

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: docker
texts.text: docker

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: docker-compose
texts.text: docker-compose

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: jellyfin
texts.text: jellyfin

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: synology
texts.text: synology

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Plex has been a mainstay for serving up media at home but it seems to have changed lately towards a more and more commercial offering. A friend recommended  Jellyfin  and I deployed it on my Synology NAS in a Docker container.
texts.text: Plex has been a mainstay for serving up media at home but it seems to have changed lately towards a more and more commercial offering. A friend recommended  Jellyfin  and I deployed it on my Synology NAS in a Docker container.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I did a few quick tests in a web browser and everything looked good. But then my Jellyfin android app told me:
texts.text: I did a few quick tests in a web browser and everything looked good. But then my Jellyfin android app told me:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Playback failed due to a fatal player error
texts.text: Playback failed due to a fatal player error

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Everything looked fine in the browser, so it was time to dig in.
texts.text: Everything looked fine in the browser, so it was time to dig in.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Checking the logs
texts.text: Checking the logs

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I opened up an ssh connection on the Synology to check the logs and found something unhelpful:
texts.text: I opened up an ssh connection on the Synology to check the logs and found something unhelpful:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: Jellyfin.Api.Helpers.TranscodingJobHelper: FFmpeg exited with code 1
texts.text: Jellyfin.Api.Helpers.TranscodingJobHelper: FFmpeg exited with code 1

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Running a few searches led me down rabbit holes to plenty of GitHub issues. None of them fixed the issue.
texts.text: Running a few searches led me down rabbit holes to plenty of GitHub issues. None of them fixed the issue.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Checking the browser again
texts.text: Checking the browser again

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I went through a few different videos from the Synology and played each. They all looked fine in Firefox until I reached one that seemed to stutter. The frame rate looked as if at least half of the frames were bring dropped.
texts.text: I went through a few different videos from the Synology and played each. They all looked fine in Firefox until I reached one that seemed to stutter. The frame rate looked as if at least half of the frames were bring dropped.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: That particular video was in 4K with a high bit rate. Back on the synology, the CPU usage was through the roof.
texts.text: That particular video was in 4K with a high bit rate. Back on the synology, the CPU usage was through the roof.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I configured graphics acceleration when I deployed Jellyfin. Perhaps it wasn't working?
texts.text: I configured graphics acceleration when I deployed Jellyfin. Perhaps it wasn't working?

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Jellyfin deployment
texts.text: Jellyfin deployment

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I deployed Jellyfin using the upstream guides with docker-compose:
texts.text: I deployed Jellyfin using the upstream guides with docker-compose:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
jellyfin:
  image: docker.io/jellyfin/jellyfin:latest
  container_name: jellyfin
  user: 1026:100
  network_mode: "host"
  devices:
    - /dev/dri
  volumes:
    # removed
  restart: "unless-stopped"
texts.text:
jellyfin:
  image: docker.io/jellyfin/jellyfin:latest
  container_name: jellyfin
  user: 1026:100
  network_mode: "host"
  devices:
    - /dev/dri
  volumes:
    # removed
  restart: "unless-stopped"

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: One of the GitHub issues I stumbled upon suggested being specific about the video devices that are mounted inside the container.
texts.text: One of the GitHub issues I stumbled upon suggested being specific about the video devices that are mounted inside the container.

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ ls -al /dev/dri
total 0
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root              80 Jun 10 20:23 .
drwxr-xr-x 12 root root           14140 Jun 10 20:24 ..
crw-------  1 root root        226,   0 Jun 10 20:24 card0
crw-rw----  1 root videodriver 226, 128 Jun 10 20:24 renderD128
texts.text:
$ ls -al /dev/dri
total 0
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root              80 Jun 10 20:23 .
drwxr-xr-x 12 root root           14140 Jun 10 20:24 ..
crw-------  1 root root        226,   0 Jun 10 20:24 card0
crw-rw----  1 root videodriver 226, 128 Jun 10 20:24 renderD128

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I adjusted the deployment in
texts.text: I adjusted the deployment in

texts.label: code
texts.orig: docker-compose.yaml
texts.text: docker-compose.yaml

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: and tried again:
texts.text: and tried again:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
jellyfin:
  image: docker.io/jellyfin/jellyfin:latest
  container_name: jellyfin
  user: 1026:100
  network_mode: "host"
  devices:
    - /dev/dri/renderD128:/dev/dri/renderD128
    - /dev/dri/card0:/dev/dri/card0
  volumes:
    # removed
  restart: "unless-stopped"
texts.text:
jellyfin:
  image: docker.io/jellyfin/jellyfin:latest
  container_name: jellyfin
  user: 1026:100
  network_mode: "host"
  devices:
    - /dev/dri/renderD128:/dev/dri/renderD128
    - /dev/dri/card0:/dev/dri/card0
  volumes:
    # removed
  restart: "unless-stopped"

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I redeployed jellyfin:
texts.text: I redeployed jellyfin:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: $ docker-compose up -d jellyfin
texts.text: $ docker-compose up -d jellyfin

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The Android app still had the fatal player error.
texts.text: The Android app still had the fatal player error.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Users and groups
texts.text: Users and groups

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Most of my Synology containers use the uid/gid pair of
texts.text: Most of my Synology containers use the uid/gid pair of

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: so allow them to read and write to my storage volume. The
texts.text: so allow them to read and write to my storage volume. The

texts.label: code
texts.orig: /dev/dri/renderD128
texts.text: /dev/dri/renderD128

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: is owned by the
texts.text: is owned by the

texts.label: code
texts.orig: videodriver
texts.text: videodriver

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: group:
texts.text: group:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ grep videodriver /etc/group
videodriver::937:PlexMediaServer
texts.text:
$ grep videodriver /etc/group
videodriver::937:PlexMediaServer

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This likely came from a time when I installed Plex on Synology via one of the Synology applications rather than from a container. (I'm not sure, but that's my guess.)
texts.text: This likely came from a time when I installed Plex on Synology via one of the Synology applications rather than from a container. (I'm not sure, but that's my guess.)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I added that group to the container:
texts.text: I added that group to the container:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
jellyfin:
  image: docker.io/jellyfin/jellyfin:latest
  container_name: jellyfin
  user: 1026:100
  network_mode: "host"
  group_add:
    - "937"
  devices:
    - /dev/dri/renderD128:/dev/dri/renderD128
    - /dev/dri/card0:/dev/dri/card0
  volumes:
    # removed
  restart: "unless-stopped"
texts.text:
jellyfin:
  image: docker.io/jellyfin/jellyfin:latest
  container_name: jellyfin
  user: 1026:100
  network_mode: "host"
  group_add:
    - "937"
  devices:
    - /dev/dri/renderD128:/dev/dri/renderD128
    - /dev/dri/card0:/dev/dri/card0
  volumes:
    # removed
  restart: "unless-stopped"

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: After redeploying the container, the Android app worked just fine! Also, the video stuttering disappeared when viewing the 4K video from the browser. 🎉
texts.text: After redeploying the container, the Android app worked just fine! Also, the video stuttering disappeared when viewing the 4K video from the browser. 🎉
